me.aliceq.heatmap

Class HeatMap<K extends java.lang.Comparable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.aliceq.heatmap.HeatMap<K>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - Comparable key type

    public class HeatMap<K extends java.lang.Comparable>
extends java.lang.Object
    An extension of a Heatlist which provides key-based access using a sorted list. Accesses are performed in O(logn).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HeatMap()
      Constructs an empty HeatMap
      HeatMap(int initialCapacity)
      Constructs an empty HeatMap with specified initial capacity

      • touch

        public boolean touch(K key)
        Verifies that a key exists and if not, it creates it
        Parameters:
        key - the key to add
        Returns:
        true if a new key was made or false if the key already exists

      • removeKey

        public boolean removeKey(K key)
        Delete a key and its corresponding value from the map, normalizing the map as needed
        Parameters:
        key - the key to remove
        Returns:
        true if successful or false if the key doesn't exist

      • discardKey

        public boolean discardKey(K key)
        Delete a key and its corresponding value from the map. Unlike removeKey, this method simply removes the data at the risk of denormalizing a normalized HeatMap.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to remove
        Returns:
        true if successful or false if the key doesn't exist

      • contains

        public boolean contains(K key)
        Checks if a key exists
        Parameters:
        key - the key to check
        Returns:
        true if the key exists

      • getValue

        public float getValue(K key)
        Retrieves the value at a certain key. If the key doesn't exist a value of 0 is returned.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to retrieve
        Returns:
        the value at the given key or 0

      • Clear

        public void Clear()
        Clears the HeatMap

      • set

        public void set(K key,
                float value)
        Overwrites the value at a given key. If the key doesn't exist, a new key is made. Note that this flags a HeatMap as denormalized.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to set
        value - the value to set

      • increment

        public float increment(K key)
        Increments the value of a key by a sample. If the key doesn't exist, a new key is made.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to increment
        Returns:
        the new value at the given key

      • increment

        public float increment(K key,
                       int amount)
        Increments the value of a key by an amount of samples. If the key doesn't exist, a new key is made.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to increment
        amount - the number of samples to increase
        Returns:
        the new value at the given key

      • incrementIfExists

        public float incrementIfExists(K key)
        Increments the value of a key by an amount of samples. If the key doesn't exist this method returns 0.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to increment
        Returns:
        the new value at the given key or 0

      • incrementIfExists

        public float incrementIfExists(K key,
                               int amount)
        Increments the value of a key by an amount of samples. If the key doesn't exist this method returns 0.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to increment
        amount - the number of samples to increase
        Returns:
        the new value at the given key or 0

      • verifyNormalization

        public boolean verifyNormalization()
        Flags the HeatMap as normalized if the sum of its values equals 1.0f or 0f (+/-.00001f)
        Returns:
        true if the List is normalized, false otherwise

      • toMap

        public java.util.Map<K,java.lang.Float> toMap()
        Returns a read-only map of all the key-value pairs in the HeatMap
        Returns:
        a new Map instance

      • touch

        protected boolean touch(K key,
                        int index)
        Verifies that a key exists and if not, it creates it. This method should only be used with an external call to positionOf in order to minimize positionOf calls. Using any other index may cause errors or put the map in an illegal state.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to add
        index - the index to touch. This should be obtained using KeyToIndex(key).
        Returns:
        true if a new key was made or false if the key already exists

      • getEntry

        public java.util.Map.Entry<K,java.lang.Float> getEntry(K key)
        Retrieves the value at the given key as a Map.Entry
        Parameters:
        key - the key to retrieve
        Returns:
        a new Map.Entry

                            K key)

      • getSampleCount

        Returns the number of samples in the map
        Returns:
        the number of samples in the map

      • checkValidity

        public boolean checkValidity(int index,
                             K key)
        Verifies that the given key can go into the provided index. That is, it is either being added to the end or the key at the given location is different. Note that this method does not check if the key already exists in another index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index to touch
        key - the key to verify
        Returns:
        true if the key is valid at the given index
